field_speakers.processed: Michael B. McElroy, Gilbert Butler Professor of Environmental Studies at Harvard University; Chair of the Harvard-China Project on Energy, Economy and Environment

field_description.processed: India, the second most populous country on the planet, has enormous energy demands. It is investing billions in renewable power, with the goal of generating 50 percent of its energy requirement from renewables by 2030. Join Professor Michael B. McElroy as he explores India’s path to a decarbonized power system. Co-sponsored by the Harvard-China Project on Energy, Economy and Environment and the Lakshmi Mittal and Family South Asia Institute at Harvard University.
